name: Songs of the Season: Nostalgic Movie Moments
description:
This year features traditional carols and familiar heart-warming tunes from classic holiday movies including songs from The Grinch Who Stole Christmas, Elf, A Charlie Brown Christmas, Home Alone, The Sound of Music, and Frozen. 

This is a great concert for families to enjoy together, sung by children, for children and for the child in all of us.

name: Montgomery's Inn: Carols in the Tavern
description: Montgomery's Inn and The Music Studio invite you to Carols in the Tavern on December 14 at 1:00 pm. This free event is sure to get you and your family in the holiday spirit with performances of Christmas classics and festive favourites by vocal students of The Music Studio. Lyric sheets will be provided so that you can sing-along!

name: Winter Market
description:
Our winter market brings together amazing local makers, great food, and festive cheer for the Malvern community! Every purchase supports small businesses in our neighborhood.

The first 50 visitors will receive a free warm meal.

We hope to see you there!

name: Manidoo-Giizoons Fashion Show and Market
description:
Aaniin/ Hello! We invite you all to attend the Manidoo-Giizoons Fashion Show and market this holiday season. 

Event Schedule: 
- noon Market begins with an Elder opening & smudge
- 2 to 3pm Fashion Show

We suggest brining cash as not all vendors have interact. We look forward to seeing you. 

Miigwetch

name: Oakland Stroke
description:
Recreating the sound and soul of the fabled Bay Area band, Tower of Power! 

Enjoy classics like "You're Still a Young Man", "Down to the Nightclub", "You've Got To Funkifize" and many more. 

Founded in 2014 by Lou Pomanti and Tony Carlucci, Oakland Stroke has been a labour of love from the very start. Lou and Tony grew up with the music of Tower of Power right from the early 1970s, first seeing them in concert at Massey Hall in Toronto in 1976.

Oakland Stroke is a smoking 10 piece band, including a five-man horn section, the same lineup Tower of Power uses live to this day.

name: Holiday Food & Story Sharing Circle at Scarborough Museum
description:
Join Scarborough Museum and Veneise George for a celebration of the way food and stories intertwine during the holidays!

Participants will gather for a story-sharing circle, getting to know one another and presenting a dish that connects them to a feeling of home during the holiday season, then enjoy these recipes and stories in a communal potluck-style meal! All are welcome for this family-friendly gathering. 

Veneise George is a wife, proud mom of two, entrepreneur, and the passionate force behind YAWDI'S—a premium condiment brand rooted in bold Caribbean flavors, cultural heritage, and handcrafted quality.

This workshop is part of Scarborough Museum's Season of Celebration - a series of family-friendly activities that celebrate light, love, and joy through food, culture, and storytelling.

name: Cicada Woods
description:
A new kind of string quartet pushing the boundaries of the strings sonic universe. 

A project born when dear musical friends Suhashini Arulanandam (violin), Esme Allen-Creighton (viola), Sybil Shanahan (cello) and Shannon Wojewoda (double bass) spent three magical days by Pine Lake exploring how their instruments could mimic and expand upon the traditional sounds of Argentinian Tango. 

Following this tradition, each instrument is a soloist and virtuoso as well as ensemble musician. Cicada Woods also use their virtuosity to maintain the rich texture of traditional tango ensembles, arranging parts where instruments frequently carry multiple lines and harmonies.

name: Madera y Cuerdas: December Tablao 2025
description:
Do you love music?  Then don't miss our grand finale of the 2025 monthly flamenco tablao series! 

Bringing together Toronto's leading flamenco guitarists Benjamin Barrile, Nicolas Hernandez, Matt Sellick and percussionist Rosendo Chendy León Arocha for an unforgettable evening of Spanish, Latin and Canadian music.

Their beautiful and powerful melodies, harmonies, and incredible technique will sweep you away! It's the perfect way to celebrate the festive season, sit back, relax, and enjoy live music with your favourite drink and food. 

This is a truly rare and amazing opportunity to see all of them on the same stage, hope to see you there!

name: Village Wonderland
description:
Get ready to experience the magic of the season! 

Join us for a day filled with festive fun, live entertainment, train rides, Santa photos, cookie decorating, and a holiday market packed with local treats and treasures. 

Bring your family and friends to celebrate with lights, laughter, and community spirit, all while supporting Variety's programs that help kids and youth thrive across Ontario.

name: The Medicine Chest:  Concert with Trevor Cape, David Celia and Vie
description:
You pick the vibes, we pick the songs.

Music is medicine and the songs we carry in our hearts, and share, offer powerful companionship in our journeys through life.

Part intimacy container, part artist showcase and part game show, come together to honour the energies that nourish us into our best selves through music, delivering the songs you didn't know you needed, but ask for by vibe.

What qualities do you want to power up with now?

name: TIFF's Sing Along Screenings
description:
Enjoy a lineup of beloved movie musicals for all ages. 

Join us for Mary Poppins with award-winning comedian Martha Chavez, The Greatest Showman and The Lion King, where actor Salvatore Antonio, who portrayed Scar in the most recent Toronto production of Disney's The Lion King, will lead the singing.

name: HUGE
description:
Playing all the bangers from a variety of genres, with a specific emphasis on RnB and Neo-Soul. Dance and sing along! 

Enjoy the familiar sounds of 90's RnB to contemporary pop with revamped arrangements that showcase all of the musicians unique voices. The members of the group are Amelia Northey-Taylor on vocals, Daniel Bado on guitar, Jen Lo on keyboard, Gabriela Laconsay on bass, and Mitch Milley on drums.

name: Isaak Bonk
description:
A frequent performer within and around the Roots community in Toronto. 

In a short amount of time, Isaak has composed a formidable repertoire of original music, while paying respect to the songs of classic songwriters such as Townes van Bandit, Bob Dylan, Woody Guthrie and folk music.

name: Red Hot Ramble
description:
Performing traditional jazz, blues, funk, along with second lines in the spirit of the great city of New Orleans but with a distinctly Canadian flavour! 

Red Hot Ramble is music about people, their loves and their hate, their blues and their celebrations of life! 

Guaranteed you won't be able to sit still when you come to one of our performances, Red Hot Ramble is a much for dancing as it is for listening and singing along too. To borrow an old Louisiana saying, "Come as You Are, Leave Different", Red Hot Ramble has a well earned reputation for their performances living up to that motto.
